notes: The Golden Era. E36 steering racks fit E30s. E46 control arms fit E30/E36 (for wide angle/drift). E36 M3 brakes fit non-M E36s. Engines (M50/M52/S50/S52) are easily swapped into E30s. The Z3 is an E36 front / E30 rear hybrid.

The E38 and E39 share many electronics, engines (M62 V8), and transmission parts. The E53 X5 is heavily based on the E39 5-series (electronics, engines) but with E46-like suspension. E38 'Contour' seats are a popular upgrade for E39s.

The over-engineered era. W124 and W201 share suspension designs (multi-link rear). M103/M104 engines are interchangeable. R129 SL front brakes (4-piston) are a direct upgrade for W201/W124 (requires 16" wheels). W124 Sportline steering boxes fit W201s for a quicker ratio.

The M112 (V6) and M113 (V8) engines are bulletproof and shared across almost all models. The 5G-Tronic (722.6) transmission is also universal. E55 AMG (W211) brakes (8-piston!) can be fitted to other models with brackets. W203 and W209 share the entire chassis/suspension.

The N54/N55 engines are found in 1, 3, and 5 series cars. Intercoolers, downpipes, and charge pipes often interchange between E82 (1-series) and E90 (3-series). The B58 engine in the F30 340i is the same as the Mk5 Supra, meaning Supra performance parts fit BMWs and vice versa.
